title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-4.4 - Children's sleepwear
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 80-4.4 - Children's sleepwear

State Regulations

Any item of children's sleepwear shall be deemed highly
flammable and dangerous if it fails to meet the standard contained in Appendix
F-5 of this Part (Standard for the Flammability of Children's Sleepwear, DOC FF
3-71, as amended, issued by the U.S. Secretary of Commerce). This section shall
become effective on July 29, 1973, provided however, that the temporary
labeling requirements for non-complying items in paragraph.5(b) of Appendix F-5
of this Part (Standard for the Flammability of Children's Sleepwear, DOC FF
3-71, as amended, issued by the U.S. Secretary of Commerce) shall become
effective on April 27, 1973. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
80-4.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
